skill.name: brainstorming
skill.description: Use when creating or developing anything, before writing code or implementation plans - refines rough ideas into fully-formed designs through structured Socratic questioning, alternative exploration, and incremental validation
skill.summary: Transform rough ideas into fully-formed designs through structured questioning and validation
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill for brainstorming methodology with no executable code. All 43 static findings are false positives from pattern matching against documentation content. The skill contains only markdown documentation describing a structured design process.

content.user_title: Transform Ideas into Designs with Structured Brainstorming
content.value_statement: Many developers struggle to turn rough ideas into clear designs before coding. This skill guides you through structured questioning, alternative exploration, and incremental validation to refine concepts into implementation-ready designs.
actual_capabilities: Guide structured brainstorming sessions using Socratic questioning methodology
Present multiple architectural approaches with trade-off analysis
Validate designs incrementally through phased feedback collection
Integrate with using-git-worktrees and writing-plans skills for implementation handoff
Use AskUserQuestion tool for structured decision-making with clear options
limitations: Does not write code or create implementation artifacts directly
Requires active user participation and decision-making throughout the process
Focuses on design methodology rather than domain-specific technical guidance
Effectiveness depends on user engagement with questioning and validation phases

use_cases.title: Feature Architecture Planning
use_cases.description: Software engineers use this skill before implementing new features to explore architectural options, evaluate trade-offs, and validate design decisions with structured feedback loops.

use_cases.title: Product Design Refinement
use_cases.description: Product managers use this skill to transform initial product ideas into detailed specifications by systematically exploring constraints, success criteria, and alternative approaches.

use_cases.title: Technical Solution Design
use_cases.description: Technical leads use this skill to facilitate design discussions, evaluate multiple implementation strategies, and build consensus through incremental design presentation and validation.

prompt_templates.title: Start Basic Brainstorming Session
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me brainstorm a design for adding user authentication to my web application
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginning a new feature design process

prompt_templates.title: Explore Multiple Approaches
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to add caching to my API but I am not sure which approach to use. Can you help me explore options?

prompt_templates.title: Refine Existing Concept
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a rough idea for a notification system. Help me refine it into a complete design before I start coding.
prompt_templates.scenario: Converting rough ideas into detailed designs

prompt_templates.title: Validate Complex Design
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to design a microservices architecture for order processing. Walk me through the design process with validation at each step.
prompt_templates.scenario: Designing complex systems with incremental validation

output_examples.input: Help me brainstorm a design for adding user authentication
output_examples.output: I am using the brainstorming skill to refine your idea into a design. Let me start by understanding your requirements. What is the primary authentication method you want to support for your users?

output_examples.input: I want to add caching but not sure which approach
output_examples.output: I am using the brainstorming skill to explore caching options with you. Let me propose three architectural approaches: 1) In-memory caching with Redis (scalable, requires infrastructure, fast access), 2) Application-level caching (simple setup, limited scalability, no external dependencies), 3) CDN-based caching (global distribution, higher cost, best for static content). Which approach resonates with your needs?

best_practices: Use the AskUserQuestion tool for presenting structured choices with clear trade-offs during understanding and exploration phases
Present designs incrementally in 200 to 300 word sections and validate each section before proceeding to maintain alignment
Always propose 2 to 3 alternative approaches before settling on a final design to ensure comprehensive option evaluation
anti_patterns: Asking multiple questions simultaneously instead of one focused question at a time during the understanding phase
Proceeding to implementation planning before completing design validation and receiving explicit user approval
Using open-ended questions for decisions that have clear mutually exclusive options instead of structured AskUserQuestion tool

faq.question: When should I use this brainstorming skill?
faq.answer: Use this skill before writing code or creating implementation plans when you have a rough idea that needs refinement. It is most valuable for feature design, architecture decisions, or any situation where exploring alternatives would improve the final outcome.

faq.question: How does this skill differ from regular planning?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on ideation and design refinement through structured questioning and alternative exploration. It precedes planning by helping you arrive at a validated design. After brainstorming completes, you can use the writing-plans skill for implementation planning.

faq.question: Can I skip phases if I already know what I want?
faq.answer: The skill allows flexible progression, but exploring alternatives in Phase 2 often reveals better approaches even when you think you know the solution. You can move quickly through phases but should not skip the alternative exploration entirely.

faq.question: What happens after the design is validated?
faq.answer: After design validation, the skill can invoke the using-git-worktrees skill to set up an isolated workspace, then use the writing-plans skill to create a detailed implementation plan in that workspace.

faq.question: Does this skill write any code?
faq.answer: No, this skill does not write code. It focuses exclusively on design methodology and refinement. Code writing happens during implementation after you use the writing-plans skill to create an implementation plan.

faq.question: How does the AskUserQuestion tool integration work?
faq.answer: The skill uses the AskUserQuestion tool during understanding and exploration phases to present structured choices with descriptions and trade-offs. This ensures clear decision-making and prevents vague responses when evaluating alternatives.
